required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I / II Trial of Nintedanib in Asian Hepatocellular Carcinoma Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open Label, Phase I/Randomized II Study to Evaluate Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Efficacy of BIBF 1120 in Comparison With Sorafenib for Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma Patients in Asia.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to evaluate the safety, appropriate dose, and efficacy of BIBF 1120 in liver cancer patients

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Tolerated Dose in Phase I
primary_outcome.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose studied for which the incidence of DLTs was 0/3 or less than 2/6 patients during the first treatment course.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Progression (TTP) in Phase II
primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until data cut-off (28 Sep 2012); Up to 77 weeks
primary_outcome.description: TTP according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) 1.0 criteria based on central independent review. TTP RECIST 1.0 was defined as the time from randomisation to disease progression according to RECIST 1.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Progression (TTP) in Phase II (Follow-up Analyses)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until disease progression or data cut-off (16 Jul 2014); Up to 171 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: TTP according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) 1.0 criteria based on central independent review. TTP RECIST 1.0 was defined as the time from randomisation to disease progression according to RECIST 1.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and Intensity of Adverse Events (AEs) Reported as the Number of Patients With AEs According to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 3.0 Throughout the Treatment Period.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: AEs with an onset during therapy with study treatment or within 28 days after discontinuation of study treatment (up to 1066 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence and worst intensity (severity) of Adverse Events with grading according to the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE version 3.0).

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Dose Limiting Toxicity in Phase I
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with dose limiting toxicity are presented

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until data cut-off (16 July 2014); Up to 171 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Objective RECIST 1.0 tumour response was defined as Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) and was derived from the patient's best objective RECIST 1.0 response based on central independent review. 95% Confidence Interval presented below are computed by Clopper and Pearson method.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until data cut-off (16 July 2014); Up to 171 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: PFS by RECIST 1.0 was defined as the duration from date of randomisation to date of progression or death, whichever occurred earlier, based on central independent review.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until data cut-off (16 July 2014); Up to 171 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the duration from date of randomisation to the date of death.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-12,ss,Norm (Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve Between 0 and 12 Hours at Steady State, Normalised Values) of Nintedanib
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-12,ss,norm (area under the plasma concentration-time curve between 0 and 12 hours at steady state, normalised values) of Nintedanib Detailed time points of sampling are: Phase I and selected phase II patients in the Nintedanib arm: Cycle 1, Day 15 to 16: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 1 hour (h), 2 h, 3 h, 4 h, 5 h, 7 h, 10 h, 12 h and 24 h after drug administration on Day 15; Cycle 2, Day 1: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 1; Cycle 2, Day 15: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-12,ss,Norm (Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve Between 0 and 12 Hours at Steady State, Normalised Values) of BIBF 1202 (Metabolite of Nintedanib)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-12,ss,norm (area under the plasma concentration-time curve between 0 and 12 hours at steady state, normalised values) of BIBF 1202 (metabolite of Nintedanib). Detailed time points of sampling are: Phase I and selected phase II patients in the Nintedanib arm: Cycle 1, Day 15 to 16: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 1 hour (h), 2 h, 3 h, 4 h, 5 h, 7 h, 10 h, 12 h and 24 h after drug administration on Day 15; Cycle 2, Day 1: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 1; Cycle 2, Day 15: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-12,ss,Norm (Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve Between 0 and 12 Hours at Steady State, Normalised Values) of BIBF 1202 Glucuronide (Metabolite of Nintedanib)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-12,ss,norm of BIBF 1202 glucuronide (Metabolite of Nintedanib): Detailed time points of sampling are: Phase I and selected phase II patients in the Nintedanib arm: Cycle 1, Day 15 to 16: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 1 hour (h), 2 h, 3 h, 4 h, 5 h, 7 h, 10 h, 12 h and 24 h after drug administration on Day 15; Cycle 2, Day 1: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 1; Cycle 2, Day 15: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax,ss,Norm (Maximum Concentration of the Nintedanib in Plasma at Steady State, Normalised Values)
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax,ss,norm (maximum concentration of the Nintedanib in plasma at steady state, normalised values). Detailed time points of sampling are: Phase I and selected phase II patients in the Nintedanib arm: Cycle 1, Day 15 to 16: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 1 hour (h), 2 h, 3 h, 4 h, 5 h, 7 h, 10 h, 12 h and 24 h after drug administration on Day 15; Cycle 2, Day 1: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 1; Cycle 2, Day 15: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax,ss,Norm (Maximum Concentration of the BIBF 1202 in Plasma at Steady State, Normalised Values)
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax,ss,norm (maximum concentration of the BIBF 1202 in plasma at steady state, normalised values). Detailed time points of sampling are: Phase I and selected phase II patients in the Nintedanib arm: Cycle 1, Day 15 to 16: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 1 hour (h), 2 h, 3 h, 4 h, 5 h, 7 h, 10 h, 12 h and 24 h after drug administration on Day 15; Cycle 2, Day 1: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 1; Cycle 2, Day 15: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax,ss,Norm (Maximum Concentration of the BIBF 1202 Glucuronide in Plasma at Steady State, Normalised Values)
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax,ss,norm (maximum concentration of the BIBF 1202 glucuronide in plasma at steady state, normalised values). Detailed time points of sampling are: Phase I and selected phase II patients in the Nintedanib arm: Cycle 1, Day 15 to 16: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 1 hour (h), 2 h, 3 h, 4 h, 5 h, 7 h, 10 h, 12 h and 24 h after drug administration on Day 15; Cycle 2, Day 1: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 1; Cycle 2, Day 15: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 15.

secondary_outcome.measure: fe0-12,ss (Fraction Excreted in Urine Between 0 and 12 Hours at Steady State) for Nintedanib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 to 4 hours (h), 4 to 12 h, and 12 to 24 h after nintedanib
secondary_outcome.description: fe0-12,ss (fraction excreted in urine between 0 and 12 hours at steady state) for Nintedanib. The reported value corresponds to the percentage of administered dose.

arm_group.description: Phase I dose escalation and phase II using dose determined in phase I
Twice daily dosing in phase II

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Hepatocellular carcinoma, either histologically/cytologically confirmed or clinically diagnosed, which is not amenable to curative surgery or loco-regional therapy
2. Age 18 years or older
3. Eastern Cooperative Group performance score of 2 or less
4. Child-Pugh score of 7 or less
5. Written informed consent in accordance with International Conference on Harmonisation (ICH) and Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and local legislation
Exclusion criteria:
1. Prior systemic therapy for metastatic/unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma (for phase II)
2. More than one line of prior systemic therapy for metastatic/unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma (for phase I)
3. Uncontrolled or refractory ascites to adequate medical therapy
4. Bilirubin greater than 1.5 times upper limit of normal
5. Aspartate amino transferase or alanine amino transferase greater than 5 times upper limit of normal
6. Absolute neutrophil count less than 1500/microliter
7. Platelet count less than 75000/microliter
8. Hemoglobin less than 9 g/dL
9. Serum creatinine greater than 1.5 times upper limit of normal

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The trial consisted of 2 Phases. Patients were stratified into 1 of 2 groups according to their aspartate aminotransferase (AST)/alanine aminotransferase (ALT) and Child-Pugh score at baseline.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Group 1 patients had a baseline Child-Pugh score of 5 or 6, and AST (aspartate aminotransferase ) and ALT (alanine transaminase) ≤2 times the upper limit of normal (ULN). Group 2 patients had a baseline Child-Pugh score of 7, or AST or ALT >2 to ≤5 times ULN

group.title: Phase I Group I, 100 mg Nintedanib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 100 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). Phase I: A standard 3+3 dose escalation part to determine the maximal tolerated dose (MTD) and pharmacokinetics (PK) of nintedanib.

group.title: Phase I Group 1, 150 mg Nintedanib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 150 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). Phase I: A standard 3+3 dose escalation part to determine the MTD and pharmacokinetics (PK) of nintedanib.

group.title: Phase I Group 1, 200 mg Nintedanib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 200 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). Phase I: A standard 3+3 dose escalation part to determine the MTD and pharmacokinetics (PK) of nintedanib.

group.title: Phase I Group 2, 50 mg Nintedanib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 50 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). Phase I: A standard 3+3 dose escalation part to determine the MTD and pharmacokinetics (PK) of nintedanib.

group.title: Phase I Group 2, 100 mg Nintedanib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 100 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). Phase I: A standard 3+3 dose escalation part to determine the MTD and pharmacokinetics (PK) of nintedanib.

group.title: Phase I Group 2, 150 mg Nintedanib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 150 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). Phase I: A standard 3+3 dose escalation part to determine the MTD and pharmacokinetics (PK) of nintedanib.

group.title: Phase I Group 2, 200 mg Nintedanib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 200 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). Phase I: A standard 3+3 dose escalation part to determine the MTD and pharmacokinetics (PK) of nintedanib.

group.title: Phase II, 200 mg Nintedanib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 200 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). Phase II: Patients were randomly assigned to open-label treatment with nintedanib or sorafenib. Patients were stratified for macro-vascular invasion (MVI) and/or extra-hepatic spread (EHS).

group.title: Phase II, 400 mg Sorafenib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Sorafenib 400 mg film coated tablets twice daily (bid). Phase II: Patients were randomly assigned to open-label treatment with nintedanib or sorafenib. Patients were stratified for macro-vascular invasion (MVI) and/or extra-hepatic spread (EHS).

participants_list.participants: On-treatment at analysis cut-off date (16 July 2014).
On-treatment at analysis cut-off date (16 July 2014).

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Refused to continue taking trial med.

baseline.population: Treated set (TS): Treated set included all patients who received at least one dose of trial medication

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose in Phase I
outcome.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose studied for which the incidence of DLTs was 0/3 or less than 2/6 patients during the first treatment course.
outcome.population: Treated set (Patients from the dose escalation part that were not replaced for MTD determination)

group.title: Group 1
group.description: Patients treated with nintedanib belonging to Group1 from the 2 phases, Phase I Group 1 treatment consists of nintedanib, 100, 150 or 200 mg twice daily (bid) Phase II treatment consists of Nintedanib 200 mg twice daily (bid)

group.title: Group 2
group.description: Patients treated with nintedanib belonging to Group1 from the 2 phases, Phase I Group 1 treatment consists of nintedanib, 100, 150 or 200 mg twice daily (bid) Phase II treatment consists of Nintedanib 200 mg twice daily (bid)

measure.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose in Phase I
measure.description: The MTD was defined as the highest dose studied for which the incidence of DLTs was 0/3 or less than 2/6 patients during the first treatment course.
measure.population: Treated set (Patients from the dose escalation part that were not replaced for MTD determination)

outcome.description: TTP according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) 1.0 criteria based on central independent review. TTP RECIST 1.0 was defined as the time from randomisation to disease progression according to RECIST 1.0.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization until data cut-off (28 Sep 2012); Up to 77 weeks
outcome.population: Treated set, only phase II participants.

group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 200 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). measure.title: Time to Progression (TTP) in Phase II
measure.description: TTP according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) 1.0 criteria based on central independent review. TTP RECIST 1.0 was defined as the time from randomisation to disease progression according to RECIST 1.0.
measure.population: Treated set, only phase II participants.

analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio from Cox proportional hazards model stratified by macroscopic vacular invasion, extrahepatic spread, or both present vs both absent. HR below 1 favors Nintedanib.

outcome.title: Objective Tumour Response by RECIST
outcome.description: Objective RECIST 1.0 tumour response was defined as Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) and was derived from the patient's best objective RECIST 1.0 response based on central independent review. 95% Confidence Interval presented below are computed by Clopper and Pearson method.

outcome.population: Treated set, only phase II participants.

measure.title: Objective Tumour Response by RECIST

measure.population: Treated set, only phase II participants.

outcome.population: Treated set, include only phase II participants

group.title: Phase II, 200 mg Nintedanib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 200 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid). Phase II: Patients were randomly assigned to open-label treatment with nintedanib or sorafenib. Patients were stratified for macro-vascular invasion (MVI) and/or extra-hepatic spread (EHS).

group.title: Phase II, 400 mg Sorafenib Bid
group.description: Oral administration of Sorafenib 400 mg film coated tablets twice daily (bid). Phase II: Patients were randomly assigned to open-label treatment with nintedanib or sorafenib. Patients were stratified for macro-vascular invasion (MVI) and/or extra-hepatic spread (EHS).

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival was defined as the duration from date of randomisation to the date of death.
measure.population: Treated set, include only phase II participants

analysis.estimate_desc: Hazard ratio from Cox proportional hazards model stratified by macroscopic vacular invasion, extrahepatic spread, or both present vs both absent. HR below 1 favors Nintedanib.

outcome.title: AUC0-12,ss,Norm (Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve Between 0 and 12 Hours at Steady State, Normalised Values) of Nintedanib
outcome.description: AUC0-12,ss,norm (area under the plasma concentration-time curve between 0 and 12 hours at steady state, normalised values) of Nintedanib Detailed time points of sampling are: Phase I and selected phase II patients in the Nintedanib arm: Cycle 1, Day 15 to 16: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 1 hour (h), 2 h, 3 h, 4 h, 5 h, 7 h, 10 h, 12 h and 24 h after drug administration on Day 15; Cycle 2, Day 1: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 1; Cycle 2, Day 15: Immediately prior to swallowing the dose of nintedanib (predose) and 2 h after drug administration on Day 15.
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic set (PKS): The PK set was a subset of the treated set and included all patients who received at least one dose of trial medication and for whom at least one PK observation was available.

outcome.title: fe0-12,ss (Fraction Excreted in Urine Between 0 and 12 Hours at Steady State) for Nintedanib
outcome.description: fe0-12,ss (fraction excreted in urine between 0 and 12 hours at steady state) for Nintedanib. The reported value corresponds to the percentage of administered dose.
outcome.time_frame: 0 to 4 hours (h), 4 to 12 h, and 12 to 24 h after nintedanib
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic set (PKS): The PK set was a subset of the treated set and included all patients who received at least one dose of trial medication and for whom at least one PK observation was available.

reported_events.time_frame: AEs with an onset during therapy with study treatment or within 28 days after discontinuation of study treatment (up to 1066 days)

group.description: Oral administration of Nintedanib (BIBF 1120) 100 mg soft gelatine capsules twice daily (bid) for the Group I patients during Phase I

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI’s intellectual property rights
